place.name: EAGLE
place.gazetteerText: EAGLE, a parish in the district and county of Lincoln; adjacent to the boundary with Notts, 3½ miles WNW of Thorpe r. station, and 7½ SW by W of Lincoln. It contains the hamlet of Eagle-Barnsdale; and its post town is Swinderby, under Newark. Acres, with Eagle-Hall, 2, 450. Real property, £2, 144. Pop., 533. Houses, 123. The property is divided among a few. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £100. Patron, Sir W. A. Ingilby. The church is tolerable; and there are two Wesleyan chapels, and charities £5. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)

place.name: EAGLE WOODHOUSE
place.gazetteerText: EAGLE-WOODHOUSE, an extra-parochial tract in the district and county of Lincoln; near Eagle parish and the boundary with Notts. Acres, 80. Pop., 11. House, 1. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
